title: No audio on websites like TikTok, Twitter, and Instagram
content:
as the title describes: i get no audio when browsing websites like Instagram, Twitter, and TikTok. However, the browser is detecting audio (I get the speaker icon on the tab), and my sound mixer settings on my PC are correct (firefox is not muted, and the input/output settings are connected to my headset, so no issues there).

the same sound mixing settings are enabled on Chrome, and I'm able to receive audio from those same websites/pages when using that browser. but, i hate chrome, and prefer using firefox... I'm at a loss for what I can do to get audio from those websites (specifically TikTok). YouTube has always played fine for me, though.

Has anyone else experienced this?? is there a way to fix it?? surely i'm just missing a step/setting...?üò≠üò≠

title: Two-step verification
content:
To whom it may concern,

I am writing to you for the third time to express my deep frustration regarding an unacceptable problem with two-step verification.

I am trying to set up two-factor authentication, a security option that, in my opinion, should be standard and fully functional across all your services. I have tried using reliable authenticator apps such as Google Authenticator, Authy, and Proton, but none of them are working correctly.

I have already verified that my device clocks are perfectly synchronized, so the problem is not on my end. I find it impossible to understand how, in 2025, a company like Mozilla, which champions privacy and security, can have such an unreliable verification system. It's unthinkable that, when using Firefox as a primary browser, one cannot rely on a fundamental security feature like this.

I expect you to take this report with the utmost urgency and provide me with an immediate solution.

Sincerely,

A frustrated user.

title: false "firefox is already running but is not responding" error
content:
My Firefox is fine, it works normally (except for Youtube pages which take over a minute to start playing).

Today, while FF was open and working fine, I clicked on an url shortcut on my desktop and got the "firefox is already running but is not responding" error - this came after I disabled Microsoft automatic sign-in to apps and services (I run a local account). So I think that's what has screwed things up.

So now FF will only open a shortcut if it's already closed, but not if it's already open like normal. If I drag and drop the same short cut onto FF it opens no problem, so I think it's a windows screw up,..

But how to fix it ?

title: Firefox Blocking or Delaying Load on Some Resource Sites?
content:
Hi there,

Lately I‚Äôve noticed that Firefox sometimes delays or fails to load certain academic or book resource sites. One particular example is libgen.is ‚Äî I occasionally use it for accessing research materials, but Firefox either shows a security warning or takes too long to load the page.

I tested the same link on Chrome and Edge, and it loads without any issue. My Firefox is up to date, and I‚Äôve already tried clearing the cache and disabling add-ons, but the problem persists.

Could this be due to DNS settings or enhanced tracking protection? Is there a workaround or exception I can set safely?

Appreciate any help, thanks!

title: Desactivar actualizaciones de Mozilla 51
content:
Hola, buenas tardes, me pueden apoyar en indicarme cual es el proceso a seguir para que la version 51 de Mozilla no se actualice, a continuaci√≥n agrego los procedimientos que se han realizado.

Principalmente en la instalaci√≥n se ha seleccionado la opci√≥n standard donde posteriormente deshabilitamos Maintenance y bien se ha desinstalado , y la personalizada donde no se selecciona la instalaci√≥n de Maintenance. Las dos opciones se siguieron actualizando.

Posteriormente creamos un archivo json con las politicas de actualizaci√≥n en False, y desde about:config cambie las politicas de true a false, tambien configurando las actualizaciones a Nunca actualizarse. Pero se actualizo.

Despues cree una regla en el firewall local del equipo bloqueando Maintenance y borrando los archivos Updater, sin embargo se volvio a actualizar.

Y por ultimo intente cambiar los registros desde el archivo hosts en System 32 con todas las url donde busca las actualizaciones Mozilla agregando direcciones IP que no dirigen a ninguna pagina en especifico.

Es por ello que requiero de su apoyo para encontrar alguna alternativa donde no se actualice el navegador, es importante tenerlo en esta versi√≥n ya que requerimos entrar a una plataforma gubernamental que solamente se puede utilizar con esta version.

Quedo atenta a sus comentarios. Saludos
creator: rvallejo

title: Amazon often freezes and won't load pages
content:
Hi, I have a Windows 11 Home 64bit and I am using the latest version of Firefox 141.0 64 Bit.

This issue isn't just on the latest version though, it's been happening for a long time and i can't seem to find why.

I will click on my Firefox bookmark and the page will show up fine as normal, quite often, I will then click on a link within the page and nothing happens, I can see at the tab it's showing it's trying to load, but this just stops after a while. I don;t get an error page etc.. it just stops and goes no further.

This issue seems only to happen on Amazon.co.uk I don't seem to have this issue with any other site, which is odd, as it seems an issue specific to that site.

If I leave it a while, eventually the link will just start to work, and then the rest of the site seems fine, then out of the blue, it might start doing it again.

I have tried things like clearing the cookies for the site, clearing cache etc but still seems to happen.

Does anyone know what it could be?

Regards James
creator: james_uk

title: Firefox ESR 115 & Windows 7
content: Because the economy, inflation, and lower incomes are still a major problem, many users like myself need to continue using old computers that can only run Windows 7. So we need Firefox ESR 115 to continue being supported with updates for at least a couple more years.
